meaningMnemonic: You've hopefully come across 負ける by now, which means "to lose." So, you can figure out this word means "losing dog." Well, calling someone a dog isn't so nice, so you're probably just calling them a <vocabulary>loser</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: The readings are kun'yomi, but you should be familiar with 負ける and of course 犬 well enough to learn the reading here.
